description: Core PFC Python SDK module providing simulation control, domain management, and state persistence

functions.name: command
functions.description: Issue a PFC command. This is the primary way to access PFC commands not available in Python SDK. Commands are executed immediately.
functions.limitations: Cannot return command output. For queries, use specific Python SDK functions or fish variables.

functions.name: cycle
functions.description: Get the cycle number. Returns the total number of cycles executed since model initialization.

functions.name: timestep
functions.description: Get the global timestep value used for mechanical calculations.

functions.name: mech_age
functions.description: Return the accumulated mechanical time (cycle number Ã— timestep).

functions.name: dim
functions.description: Get the code dimensionality (2 for 2D, 3 for 3D).

functions.name: gravity
functions.description: Get the gravity vector. Returns a vector object with x, y, z components.

functions.name: gravity_x
functions.description: Get the x-component of gravity.

functions.name: gravity_y
functions.description: Get the y-component of gravity.

functions.name: gravity_z
functions.description: Get the z-component of gravity.

functions.name: set_gravity
functions.description: Set the gravity vector. Modifies the gravity for all objects in the simulation.

functions.name: set_gravity_x
functions.description: Set the x-component of gravity.

functions.name: set_gravity_y
functions.description: Set the y-component of gravity.

functions.name: set_gravity_z
functions.description: Set the z-component of gravity.

functions.name: domain_min
functions.description: Get domain lower bound as vector.

functions.name: domain_min_x
functions.description: Get the x-component of domain lower bound.

functions.name: domain_min_y
functions.description: Get the y-component of domain lower bound.

functions.name: domain_min_z
functions.description: Get the z-component of domain lower bound.

functions.name: domain_max
functions.description: Get domain upper bound as vector.

functions.name: domain_max_x
functions.description: Get the x-component of domain upper bound.

functions.name: domain_max_y
functions.description: Get the y-component of domain upper bound.

functions.name: domain_max_z
functions.description: Get the z-component of domain upper bound.

functions.name: set_domain_min
functions.description: Set domain lower bound as vector.

functions.name: set_domain_min_x
functions.description: Set the x-component of domain lower bound.

functions.name: set_domain_min_y
functions.description: Set the y-component of domain lower bound.

functions.name: set_domain_min_z
functions.description: Set the z-component of domain lower bound.

functions.name: set_domain_max
functions.description: Set domain upper bound as vector.

functions.name: set_domain_max_x
functions.description: Set the x-component of domain upper bound.

functions.name: set_domain_max_y
functions.description: Set the y-component of domain upper bound.

functions.name: set_domain_max_z
functions.description: Set the z-component of domain upper bound.

functions.name: domain_condition
functions.description: Get the domain condition given a domain direction. Acceptable values are 'x' or 'y' in 2D; 'x', 'y' or 'z' in 3D.

functions.name: set_domain_condition
functions.description: Set the domain condition for a given domain direction. Acceptable directions are 'x' or 'y' in 2D; 'x', 'y' or 'z' in 3D. Acceptable conditions are 'destroy', 'periodic', 'reflect' and 'stop'.

functions.name: domain_strain_rate
functions.description: Get the domain strain-rate tensor.

functions.name: set_domain_strain_rate
functions.description: Set the domain strain-rate tensor.

functions.name: add_save_variable
functions.description: Add the name of Python variable to the list of variables to be saved in the save file. Critical for state persistence and context continuity across save/restore operations.

parameters.name: variable_name
parameters.description: Name of Python variable to save

functions.name: remove_save_variable
functions.description: Remove the name of the Python variable from the list of variables to be saved in the save file.

parameters.name: variable_name
parameters.description: Name of Python variable to remove from save list

functions.name: clear_save_variables
functions.description: Clear the list of names of the Python variables to be saved in the save file.

functions.name: get_save_variables
functions.description: Get the names of the Python variables to be saved in the save file.

functions.name: set_callback
functions.signature: itasca.set_callback(function_name: str, call_point: float or str) -> None
functions.description: Register a Python function to be called during the cycling sequence. The function should exist in __main__ namespace and be callable with any number of arguments. Call_point can be a float (location in cycling sequence) or a string (pre-defined callback event).

parameters.name: function_name
parameters.description: String name of the function to register

parameters.name: call_point
parameters.description: Location in cycling sequence (float) or callback event name (str)

functions.name: remove_callback
functions.signature: itasca.remove_callback(function_name: str, call_point: float or str) -> None
functions.description: Remove a Python function from the callback system. Call_point can be a float (location in cycling sequence) or a string (pre-defined callback event).

parameters.name: function_name
parameters.description: String name of the function to remove

parameters.name: call_point
parameters.description: Location in cycling sequence (float) or callback event name (str)

functions.name: state_callbacks
functions.description: Return a dictionary of the currently defined Python new, save and restore callback events. Keys are callback points, values are tuples of Python function names.

returns.description: Dictionary of callback points to function names

functions.name: deterministic
functions.description: Get the deterministic mode. In deterministic mode, all model runs with identical initial conditions result in identical solutions at the cost of >20% performance reduction. In nondeterministic mode, identical initial conditions may lead to divergent solutions due to summation order (all solutions equally valid to machine precision).

functions.name: set_deterministic
functions.description: Set the deterministic mode. In deterministic mode, all model runs with identical initial conditions result in identical solutions at the cost of >20% performance reduction. In nondeterministic mode, identical initial conditions may lead to divergent solutions due to summation order (all solutions equally valid to machine precision).

functions.name: threads
functions.description: Get the number of threads used for parallel computations.

functions.name: set_threads
functions.description: Set the number of threads used for parallel computations.

functions.name: fos
functions.description: Get the factor of safety.

functions.name: group
functions.description: Return the group index associated with a given group name. A group index can be used instead of a string for faster execution.

functions.name: slot
functions.description: Return the slot index associated with a given slot name. A slot index can be used instead of a string for faster execution.

functions.name: mainWindow
functions.description: Get the string pointer address of the QMainWindow. Used for GUI integration.

functions.name: dockWidget
functions.signature: itasca.dockWidget(window_name: str, dock_location: str, add_close_controls: bool) -> Pointer to QDockWidget
functions.description: Return a pointer to an empty QDockWidget with the specified attributes. Use shiboken.wrapInstance to access the QDockWidget class through PySide bindings.

parameters.name: window_name
parameters.description: Name of the dock widget window
